post.Title: Java desktop links of the week, August 15
post.Content:
I know I sound like a broken record...but where does time go?! It's mid-August already! This past week was a relatively quiet one in the Java desktop world, but despite being quiet there are some very interesting links this week. Let's get into it :-)

JavaFX

  • Dean Iverson has finally blogged about the work he and Jim Clarke are doing on GroovyFX. This is a good read for anyone interested in building JavaFX 2.0 user interfaces without all the verbosity of Java.
  • Tom Eugelink put out a new release of MigLayoutFX2 to fix some bugs, and also announced a name change to MigPane to be more consistent with the naming pattern used within JavaFX.
  • Narayan has released the source code for his AutoFill TextBox. He has blogged about this previously.

Swing

  • JIDE Software has announced the release of JIDE 3.2.0, which includes a number of new features and components.

Miscellaneous

  • MiGLayout 4.0 has been released, which includes a number of bug fixes, and also now requires at least Java 5.

That's all for this week - I hope you found a few links useful! Catch you next week with more Java desktop links!
